introduction: Make Me A Match Jerusalem: Life in the Jewish-Orthodox community could be so simple: When you reach 20 you just find a partner and start a family. But Vered, Ortal and David are already in their 30s and still unmarried. They are eagerly looking to get married to finally belong to their community, while their matchmakers try their best to marry them off. With sure instinct they not only want to find a perfect match for their clients, but also treat them to whatever love and life advise they have at their disposal. The protagonists quest for love turns into a quest for identity between tradition and modernity.
